page_content:
View Edit - Instrument Calibration

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The View/Edit feature of an instrument allows users to view or modify certain instrument details existing in the application.

The View/Edit page of an instrument normally (dependent on individual portal specifics) has the following tabs:

  • Instrument Set Up (Definition)
  • Instrument Calibration
  • Calculated Calibrations
  • Review Setup
  • Readings
  • Review History
  • Edit History

 

To access the View/Edit page, perform the following steps:

  1. Once you log into the application, go to Instrument Data section in the Homepage.
  2. Select the instrument required.
  3. Click View or edit instrument. (small bar chart symbol above graph thumbnail) You reach the View/Edit page where the Instrument Set Up is open by default.
  4. Alternatively, click Data Manager from the Homepage of the portal (bar chart symbol top right). Select Instrumentation > Data > View/Edit. 

 

 

Click the Instrument Calibration tab to open the corresponding interface.

Here you can modify or remove an existing calibration or add a new revision to the instrument.

 

 

 

Click Edit to edit and adjust the calibrations of the instrument.

 

 

 

To make an additional revision, perform the following steps:

  1. Click Add New Revision.
    The Add Revision pop-up appears.
  2. Modify the values as needed.
  3. Click OK. The confirmation message appears whether to Save Only or Save and Recalculate.
  4. Choose the option based on requirement. If the latter option is selected, the instrument data will recalculate from the Initial Date to either the current timestamp or to whenever the a different Revision applies.

    NOTE: When triggering recalculation, large amounts of data can be sent to the processing stack, depending on the time period and frequency of the data sent – this may impact realtime data processing.
  5. The new revision data then appears.

 

 

 

 

 

 

To remove an existing revision, perform the following steps:

  1. Click Remove Revision.
    The Remove Revision pop-up appears. 
  2. Select the required Revision to be removed. Click OK.

 

 

 

  1. The confirmation message asks whether to Save Only or Save and Recalculate.
  2. Select the required option to remove revision.

 

 

To watch the Web User Manual video on How to view or edit Instrument Calibration, simply click on the thumbnail or link below:
